intro: Acmispon grandiflorus var. grandiflorus, commonly known as the largeflower blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and the plant has a fibrous root system. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
